definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: I was bogged down with a lot of work.
You could feel trapped by the wrong man, Professor Dai said.
sentences.chinese: 你会感觉到被不合适的男人拖住了。

sentences.english: Is there really an immature "teenage brain" that holds them back?
sentences.chinese: 真有尚未成熟的“青春期大脑”拖住他们？

sentences.english: Drag along an ice hockey with the mouse, the or so ambulation releases again a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 用鼠标拖住冰球，左右移动再放开鼠标。
他们拼命拖住我的汽车，不让我走。

sentences.english: Dragging children, do not let their children act wildly complex and self-destruction.
sentences.chinese: 二是紧紧拖住孩子，不要让孩子撒野毁物和自毁。

sentences.english: The prone shadows with their out-stretched arms clung to the feet of the hurrying light.
sentences.chinese: 倾斜的影子伸出臂膀，拖住时光匆匆的脚步。

sentences.english: He tugged heavy hand baggage down endless airport corridors.
sentences.chinese: 他拖住沉重的随身行李，走过环行的机场走廊。

sentences.english: They were bogged down by overwork.
sentences.chinese: 他们被过度的工作拖住了。

sentences.english: Chloe also said you intentionally scrambled the voice to slow down her process.
sentences.chinese: 克罗伊还说你故意在声音上做手脚以便能拖住她。

sentences.english: Delaying them to help me escape.

definition: to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
